channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti Report – Building / Electrical Door - -Black door on the building, above what appears to be an electrical hazard/warning sign (communal walkway), 14th January
item.description:
There are multiple graffiti signatures on and above the black door, including one clearly visible above the electrical hazard sign and another less visible black graffiti mark on the door itself. Each signature is approximately the size of a laptop. The graffiti is not offensive but negatively impacts the appearance of the communal area. This issue has been recurring since the start of the year, with new markings appearing recently. This is a shared residential walkway and the graffiti is visible to residents and visitors.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign for Williamson Court (communal area), 14th January
item.description:
Graffiti has appeared on the Williamson Court sign. The graffiti consists of a black marker/paint signature, approximately the size of a laptop. It appeared recently and is not offensive, but it affects the appearance of the building and makes the entrance look neglected. This sign helps identify the building, so removal of the graffiti (rather than removal of the sign) would be preferred.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Disgusting rubbish being dumped on road., 14th January
item.description:
Every week there is new rubbish being dumped at the top of ceres road. People are constantly fly tipping on here and it is disappointing and disgusting as someone who has lived on this street for 10+ years. You will see there are a number of previous reports that have been made via this app regarding the same issue ! Nothing is being done. There needs to be further action, a whole bin as been dumped there this week. There should be a sign warning fly tippers. It also attracts rodents and foxes, as well as other un-wanted pests. I have reported this to neighbourhood police before in passing and was just told to report it on this app. That was some months ago now. So what is being done ? Can we have this cleared and some preventative action taken please. Let’s all look after our neighbourhood and protect it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ceres Road, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet
